posts.name: ericjanofski
posts.cooked:
We are trying to driveToPose() from Yagsl, but we are getting the error:

Could not instantiate robot com.pathplanner.lib.commands.PathfindingCommand!

Here’s how we’re calling it (we’re giving it a rotation2d but i left it empty in the below example)…

new JoystickButton(operatorJoystick, 5).whileTrue( drivebase.driveToPose(new Pose2d(1, 1, new Rotation2d())) );

any idea?

posts.name: Jared Van Horn
posts.cooked:
Do you have a github link? These things are usually easier to troubleshoot with full code access.

I don’t think this is your issue but maybe change whileTrue to onTrue

You’re going to facepalm.

I was wracking my brain about this and ended up using another teams (Much better IMO) code for driveToPose and it still happened. After a few hours of debugging i noticed the SwerveInputStream.get function isn’t called. I then looked at the other button mappings….

I had driveToPose mapped twice. Once for PathPlanners; and once for SwerveInputStream on the same button….

Soo, remove the conflicting triggers and it should work. Bonus points if you update to the latest beta you can use a much better version IMO.

posts.name: ericjanofski
posts.cooked:
Hey there, I’m not sure if this is related to my issue. I should be able to post a github link later today.

I’m only getting the error when I add a button that calls driveToPose(). I’m not using SwerveInputStream in robot container.

Error: Could not instantiate robot com.pathplanner.lib.commands.PathfindingCommand!

I’m using the following button command and I think I need to add a DeferredCommand around it to make the call to driveToPose come after pathplanner warms up.

Here’s what i have:

I’m having trouble finding how I’d use a deferred command, maybe something like this:

PLEASE BE AWARD THE FOLLOWING CODE IS PROBABLY NOT RIGHT

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: .whileTrue( Commands.defer(() → drivebase.driveToPose( new Pose2d(1, 1, new Rotation2d())), Set.of(drivebase)));
Can you double check that you’re calling AutoBuilder setup  before instantiating the driveToPose command?

posts.name: ericjanofski
posts.cooked:
I believe Autobuilder is setup during instantiation of the swerve drive and the driveToPose() isn’t called until a button is pressed.

Here’s our code: FRC2025/src/main/java/frc/robot at main · team6637/FRC2025 · GitHub
Could you paste the full console output here?

posts.name: ericjanofski
posts.cooked: The error was resolved with the deferred command!

data.fancy_title: Cannot call yagsl pathplanner driveToPose() from a button
data.title: Cannot call yagsl pathplanner driveToPose() from a button

accepted_answer.excerpt:
.whileTrue( 
Commands.defer(() → drivebase.driveToPose( 
new Pose2d(1, 1, new Rotation2d())), 
Set.of(drivebase)));
